intro: Cajalbania immarginata, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, elliptical seeds. Cajalbania immarginata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Its unique nocturnal blooming habit makes it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
